defs.docs:
Low-level graphics abstraction for Rust. Mostly operates on data, not types.
 Designed for use by libraries and higher-level abstractions only.

defs.docs: No flags.

defs.name: ONE_TIME_SUBMIT
defs.docs:
Says that the command buffer will be recorded, submitted only once, and then reset and re-filled
 for another submission.

defs.name: RENDER_PASS_CONTINUE
defs.docs:
If set on a secondary command buffer, it says the command buffer takes place entirely inside
 a render pass. Ignored on primary command buffer.

defs.name: SIMULTANEOUS_USE
defs.docs:
Says that a command buffer can be recorded into multiple primary command buffers,
 and submitted to a queue while it is still pending.

defs.name: Level
defs.docs:
An enum that indicates at runtime whether a command buffer
 is primary or secondary, similar to what `command::Primary`
 and `command::Secondary` do at compile-time.

defs.name: begin_render_pass
defs.value: fn <T> (&mut self, render_pass: &B::RenderPass, framebuffer: &B::Framebuffer, render_area: pso::Rect, clear_values: T, first_subpass: SubpassContents) -> ()
defs.docs:
Begins recording commands for a render pass on the given framebuffer.
 `render_area` is the section of the framebuffer to render,
 `clear_values` is an iterator of `ClearValueRaw`'s to use to use for
 `clear_*` commands, one for each attachment of the render pass
 that has a clear operation.
 `first_subpass` specifies, for the first subpass, whether the
 rendering commands are provided inline or whether the render
 pass is composed of subpasses.

defs.name: next_subpass
defs.docs: Steps to the next subpass in the current render pass.

defs.name: end_render_pass
defs.docs: Finishes recording commands for the current a render pass.

defs.docs: Bind a graphics pipeline.

defs.value: fn <I, J> (&mut self, layout: &B::PipelineLayout, first_set: usize, sets: I, offsets: J) -> ()
defs.docs:
Takes an iterator of graphics `DescriptorSet`'s, and binds them to the command buffer.
 `first_set` is the index that the first descriptor is mapped to in the command buffer.

defs.name: bind_compute_pipeline
defs.docs: Bind a compute pipeline.

defs.name: bind_compute_descriptor_sets
defs.value: fn <I, J> (&mut self, layout: &B::PipelineLayout, first_set: usize, sets: I, offsets: J) -> ()
defs.docs:
Takes an iterator of compute `DescriptorSet`'s, and binds them to the command buffer,

defs.name: dispatch
defs.docs:
Execute a workgroup in the compute pipeline. `x`, `y` and `z` are the
 number of local workgroups to dispatch along each "axis"; a total of `x`*`y`*`z`
 local workgroups will be created.

defs.name: dispatch_indirect
defs.docs:
Works similarly to `dispatch()` but reads parameters from the given
 buffer during execution.

defs.name: copy_buffer
defs.value: fn <T> (&mut self, src: &B::Buffer, dst: &B::Buffer, regions: T) -> ()
defs.docs: Adds a command to copy regions from the source to destination buffer.

defs.name: copy_image
defs.value: fn <T> (&mut self, src: &B::Image, src_layout: Layout, dst: &B::Image, dst_layout: Layout, regions: T) -> ()
defs.docs:
Copies regions from the source to the destination images, which
 have the given layouts.  No format conversion is done; the source and destination
 `Layout`'s **must** have the same sized image formats (such as `Rgba8Unorm` and
 `R32`, both of which are 32 bits).

defs.name: copy_buffer_to_image
defs.value: fn <T> (&mut self, src: &B::Buffer, dst: &B::Image, dst_layout: Layout, regions: T) -> ()
defs.docs: Copies regions from the source buffer to the destination image.

defs.name: copy_image_to_buffer
defs.value: fn <T> (&mut self, src: &B::Image, src_layout: Layout, dst: &B::Buffer, regions: T) -> ()
defs.docs: Copies regions from the source image to the destination buffer.

defs.name: draw
defs.value: fn (&mut self, vertices: Range<VertexCount>, instances: Range<InstanceCount>) -> ()
defs.docs:
Performs a non-indexed drawing operation, fetching vertex attributes
 from the currently bound vertex buffers.  It performs instanced
 drawing, drawing `instances.len()`
 times with an `instanceIndex` starting with the start of the range.

defs.name: draw_indexed
defs.value: fn (&mut self, indices: Range<IndexCount>, base_vertex: VertexOffset, instances: Range<InstanceCount>) -> ()
defs.docs:
Performs indexed drawing, drawing the range of indices
 given by the current index buffer and any bound vertex buffers.
 `base_vertex` specifies the vertex offset corresponding to index 0.
 That is, the offset into the vertex buffer is `(current_index + base_vertex)`

defs.name: draw_indirect
defs.value: fn (&mut self, buffer: &B::Buffer, offset: buffer::Offset, draw_count: DrawCount, stride: u32) -> ()
defs.docs:
Functions identically to `draw()`, except the parameters are read
 from the given buffer, starting at `offset` and increasing `stride`
 bytes with each successive draw.  Performs `draw_count` draws total.
 `draw_count` may be zero.

defs.name: draw_indexed_indirect
defs.value: fn (&mut self, buffer: &B::Buffer, offset: buffer::Offset, draw_count: DrawCount, stride: u32) -> ()
defs.docs:
Like `draw_indirect()`, this does indexed drawing a la `draw_indexed()` but
 reads the draw parameters out of the given buffer.

defs.name: begin_query
defs.value: fn (&mut self, query: query::Query<B>, flags: query::ControlFlags) -> ()
defs.docs:
Begins a query operation.  Queries count operations or record timestamps
 resulting from commands that occur between the beginning and end of the query,
 and save the results to the query pool.

defs.name: end_query
defs.docs: End a query.

defs.name: reset_query_pool
defs.docs: Reset/clear the values in the given range of the query pool.

defs.name: copy_query_pool_results

defs.docs: Copy query results into a buffer.

defs.name: write_timestamp
defs.value: fn (&mut self, stage: pso::PipelineStage, query: query::Query<B>) -> ()
defs.docs: Requests a timestamp to be written.

defs.name: push_graphics_constants
defs.value: fn (&mut self, layout: &B::PipelineLayout, stages: pso::ShaderStageFlags, offset: u32, constants: &[u32]) -> ()
defs.docs:
Modify constant data in a graphics pipeline.
 Push constants are intended to modify data in a pipeline more

defs.value: fn (&mut self, layout: &B::PipelineLayout, offset: u32, constants: &[u32]) -> ()
defs.docs:
Modify constant data in a compute pipeline.

defs.name: execute_commands
defs.value: fn <'a, T, I> (&mut self, cmd_buffers: I) -> ()
defs.docs: Execute the given secondary command buffers.

defs.name: IntoRawCommandBuffer
defs.docs: A trait for types that can be converted into raw command buffer.

defs.name: into_raw
defs.docs: Converts into raw command buffer.

defs.name: Inline
defs.docs:
Contents of the subpass will be inline in the command buffer,
 NOT in secondary command buffers.

defs.name: SecondaryBuffers
defs.docs:
Contents of the subpass will be in secondary command buffers, and
 the primary command buffer will only contain `execute_command()` calls
 until the subpass or render pass is complete.

defs.name: RenderPassSecondaryEncoder
defs.docs:
An object that records commands into a command buffer where each command must
 be a call to execute a secondary command buffer.

 starting a new render pass where the actual commands are contained in

defs.docs: Hardcoded one

defs.name: R
defs.docs: Red channel

defs.name: G
defs.docs: Green channel

defs.name: B
defs.docs: Blue channel

defs.name: A
defs.docs: Alpha channel.

defs.name: Component
defs.value: Component::{Zero, One, R, G, B, A}
defs.docs:
Source channel in a swizzle configuration. Some may redirect onto
 different physical channels, some may be hardcoded to 0 or 1.

defs.name: Swizzle
defs.docs:
Channel swizzle configuration for the resource views.
 This specifies a "swizzle" operation which remaps the various
 channels of a format into a different order.  For example,
 `Swizzle(Component::B, Component::G, Component::R, Component::A)`
 will swap `RGBA` formats into `BGRA` formats and back.

defs.name: NO
defs.docs: A trivially non-swizzling configuration; performs no changes.

defs.name: Properties
defs.docs: Format properties of the physical device.

defs.name: linear_tiling
defs.docs:
A bitmask of the features supported when an image with linear tiling is requested.
 Linear tiling has a known layout in-memory so data can be copied to and from host
 memory.

defs.name: optimal_tiling
defs.docs:
A bitmask of the features supported when an image with optimal tiling is requested.
 Optimal tiling is arranged however the GPU wants; its exact layout is undefined.

defs.name: buffer_features
defs.docs: The features supported by buffers.

defs.name: ImageFeature
defs.docs: Image feature flags.

defs.name: SAMPLED
defs.docs: Image view can be sampled.

defs.name: STORAGE
defs.docs: Image view can be used as storage image.

defs.name: STORAGE_ATOMIC
defs.docs: Image view can be used as storage image (with atomics).

defs.name: COLOR_ATTACHMENT
defs.docs: Image view can be used as color and input attachment.

defs.name: COLOR_ATTACHMENT_BLEND
defs.docs: Image view can be used as color (with blending) and input attachment.

defs.name: DEPTH_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT
defs.docs: Image view can be used as depth-stencil and input attachment.

defs.name: BLIT_SRC
defs.docs: Image can be used as source for blit commands.

defs.name: BLIT_DST
defs.docs: Image can be used as destination for blit commands.

defs.name: SAMPLED_LINEAR
defs.docs:
Image can be sampled with a (mipmap) linear sampler or as blit source
 with linear sampling.
 Requires `SAMPLED` or `BLIT_SRC` flag.

defs.name: BufferFeature
defs.docs: Buffer feature flags.

defs.name: UNIFORM_TEXEL
defs.docs: Buffer view can be used as uniform texel buffer.

defs.name: STORAGE_TEXEL
defs.docs: Buffer view can be used as storage texel buffer.

defs.name: STORAGE_TEXEL_ATOMIC
defs.docs: Buffer view can be used as storage texel buffer (with atomics).

defs.name: VERTEX
defs.docs: Image view can be used as vertex buffer.

defs.name: Unorm
defs.docs: Unsigned normalized.

defs.name: Snorm
defs.docs: Signed normalized.

defs.name: Uint
defs.docs: Unsigned integer.

defs.name: Sint
defs.docs: Signed integer.

defs.name: Ufloat
defs.docs: Unsigned floating-point.

defs.name: Sfloat
defs.docs: Signed floating-point.

defs.name: Uscaled
defs.docs: Unsigned scaled integer.

defs.name: Sscaled
defs.docs: Signed scaled integer.

defs.name: Srgb
defs.docs: Unsigned normalized, SRGB non-linear encoded.

defs.name: ChannelType
defs.value: ChannelType::{Unorm, Snorm, Uint, Sint, Ufloat, Sfloat, Uscaled, Sscaled, Srgb}
defs.docs:
Type of a surface channel. This is how we interpret the
 storage allocated with `SurfaceType`.

defs.name: BaseFormat

defs.name: AsFormat
defs.docs: Conversion trait into `Format`;

defs.name: SELF

defs.name: Linear
defs.docs:
Selects multiple texels and calculates the value via multivariate interpolation.
     * 1D: Linear interpolation
     * 2D/Cube: Bilinear interpolation
     * 3D: Trilinear interpolation

defs.docs:
How to [filter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Texture_filtering) the
 image when sampling. They correspond to increasing levels of quality,
 but also cost.

defs.name: On

defs.name: D1
defs.docs: A single one-dimensional row of texels.

defs.name: D1Array
defs.docs:
An array of rows of texels. Equivalent to `D2` except that texels
 in different rows are not sampled, so filtering will be constrained
 to a single row of texels at a time.

defs.name: D2
defs.docs: A traditional 2D image, with rows arranged contiguously.

defs.name: D2Array
defs.docs:
An array of 2D images. Equivalent to `D3` except that texels in
 a different depth level are not sampled.

defs.name: D3
defs.docs: A volume image, with each 2D layer arranged contiguously.

defs.name: Cube
defs.docs: A set of 6 2D images, one for each face of a cube.

defs.name: CubeArray
defs.docs: An array of Cube images.

defs.docs: Specifies the kind of an image view.

defs.name: MUTABLE_FORMAT
defs.docs: Support creation of views with different formats.

defs.name: KIND_CUBE
defs.docs: Support creation of `Cube` and `CubeArray` kinds of views.

defs.name: KIND_2D_ARRAY
defs.docs: Support creation of `D2Array` kind of view.

defs.name: Usage
defs.docs:
TODO: Find out if TRANSIENT_ATTACHMENT + INPUT_ATTACHMENT
 are applicable on backends other than Vulkan. --AP
 Image usage flags

defs.name: TRANSFER_SRC
defs.docs: The image is used as a transfer source.

defs.name: TRANSFER_DST
defs.docs: The image is used as a transfer destination.

defs.name: SAMPLED
defs.docs: The image is a [sampled image](https://www.khronos.org/registry/vulkan/specs/1.0/html/vkspec.html#descriptorsets-sampledimage)

defs.name: STORAGE
defs.docs: The image is a [storage image](https://www.khronos.org/registry/vulkan/specs/1.0/html/vkspec.html#descriptorsets-storageimage)

defs.name: COLOR_ATTACHMENT
defs.docs: The image is used as a color attachment -- that is, color input to a rendering pass.

defs.name: DEPTH_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT
defs.docs: The image is used as a depth attachment.

defs.name: TRANSIENT_ATTACHMENT
INPUT_ATTACHMENT
can_transfer
defs.docs: Returns true if this image can be used in transfer operations.

defs.name: can_target
defs.docs: Returns true if this image can be used as a target.

defs.name: Tile
defs.docs:
Tile the image, that is, sample the coordinate modulo `1.0`, so
 addressing the image beyond an edge will "wrap" back from the
 other edge.

defs.name: Mirror
defs.docs: Mirror the image. Like tile, but uses abs(coord) before the modulo.

defs.name: Clamp
defs.docs: Clamp the image to the value at `0.0` or `1.0` respectively.

defs.name: Border
defs.docs: Use border color.

defs.name: WrapMode
defs.docs: Specifies how image coordinates outside the range `[0, 1]` are handled.

defs.name: Lod
defs.docs: A wrapper for the LOD level of an image.

defs.name: PackedColor
defs.docs: A wrapper for an RGBA color with 8 bits per texel, encoded as a u32.

defs.name: SamplerInfo
defs.value: SamplerInfo { min_filter, mag_filter, mip_filter, wrap_mode, lod_bias, lod_range, comparison, border, anisotropic }
defs.docs: Specifies how to sample from an image.

defs.name: min_filter
defs.docs: Minification filter method to use.

defs.name: mag_filter
defs.docs: Magnification filter method to use.

defs.name: mip_filter
defs.docs: Mip filter method to use.

defs.name: wrap_mode
defs.docs:
Wrapping mode for each of the U, V, and W axis (S, T, and R in OpenGL
 speak).

defs.name: lod_bias
defs.docs:
This bias is added to every computed mipmap level (N + lod_bias). For
 example, if it would select mipmap level 2 and lod_bias is 1, it will
 use mipmap level 3.

defs.name: lod_range
defs.docs: This range is used to clamp LOD level used for sampling.

defs.name: comparison
defs.docs: Comparison mode, used primary for a shadow map.

defs.name: border
defs.docs: Border color is used when one of the wrap modes is set to border.

defs.name: anisotropic
defs.docs: Anisotropic filtering.

defs.name: new
defs.docs:
Create a new sampler description with a given filter method for all filtering operations
 and a wrapping mode, using no LOD modifications.

defs.name: General
defs.docs: General purpose, no restrictions on usage.

defs.name: ColorAttachmentOptimal
defs.docs: Must only be used as a color attachment in a framebuffer.

defs.name: DepthStencilAttachmentOptimal
defs.docs: Must only be used as a depth attachment in a framebuffer.

defs.name: DepthStencilReadOnlyOptimal
defs.docs:
Must only be used as a depth attachment in a framebuffer,
 or as a read-only depth or stencil buffer in a shader.

defs.name: ShaderReadOnlyOptimal
defs.docs: Must only be used as a read-only image in a shader.

defs.name: TransferSrcOptimal
defs.docs: Must only be used as the source for a transfer command.

defs.name: TransferDstOptimal
defs.docs: Must only be used as the destination for a transfer command.

defs.name: Undefined
defs.docs:
No layout, does not support device access.  Only valid as a
 source layout when transforming data to a specific destination
 layout or initializing data.  Does NOT guarentee that the contents
 of the source buffer are preserved.

defs.name: Preinitialized
defs.docs:
Like `Undefined`, but does guarentee that the contents of the source
 buffer are preserved.

defs.name: Present
defs.docs: The layout that an image must be in to be presented to the display.

defs.name: Layout
defs.value: Layout::{General, ColorAttachmentOptimal, DepthStencilAttachmentOptimal, DepthStencilReadOnlyOptimal, ShaderReadOnlyOptimal, TransferSrcOptimal, TransferDstOptimal, Undefined, Preinitialized, Present}
defs.docs:
Specifies options for how memory for an image is arranged.
 These are hints to the GPU driver and may or may not have actual
 performance effects, but describe constraints on how the data
 may be used that a program *must* obey. They do not specify
 how channel values or such are laid out in memory; the actual
 image data is considered opaque.

defs.name: Access
defs.docs: Bitflags to describe how memory in an image or buffer can be accessed.

defs.name: INPUT_ATTACHMENT_READ
defs.docs: Read access to an input attachment from within a fragment shader.

defs.name: SHADER_READ
defs.docs: Read-only state for SRV access, or combine with `SHADER_WRITE` to have r/w access to UAV.

defs.name: SHADER_WRITE
defs.docs:
Writeable state for UAV access.
 Combine with `SHADER_READ` to have r/w access to UAV.

defs.name: COLOR_ATTACHMENT_READ
defs.docs: Read state but can only be combined with `COLOR_ATTACHMENT_WRITE`.

defs.name: COLOR_ATTACHMENT_WRITE
defs.docs: Write-only state but can be combined with `COLOR_ATTACHMENT_READ`.

defs.name: DEPTH_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT_READ
defs.docs: Read access to a depth/stencil attachment in a depth or stencil operation.

defs.name: DEPTH_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT_WRITE
defs.docs: Write access to a depth/stencil attachment in a depth or stencil operation.

defs.name: TRANSFER_READ
defs.docs: Read access to the buffer in a copy operation.

defs.name: TRANSFER_WRITE
defs.docs: Write access to the buffer in a copy operation.

defs.name: HOST_READ
defs.docs: Read access for raw memory to be accessed by the host system (ie, CPU).

defs.name: HOST_WRITE
defs.docs: Write access for raw memory to be accessed by the host system.

defs.name: MEMORY_READ
defs.docs:
Read access for memory to be accessed by a non-specific entity.  This may
 be the host system, or it may be something undefined or specified by an
 extension.

defs.name: MEMORY_WRITE
defs.docs: Write access for memory to be accessed by a non-specific entity.

defs.docs: Image state, combining access methods and the image's layout.

defs.name: StencilTest
defs.docs:
Defines a stencil test. Stencil testing is an operation
 performed to cull fragments;
 the new fragment is tested against the value held in the

defs.docs:
Specifies how the alpha channel of the images should be handled during
 compositing.

defs.name: OPAQUE
defs.docs:
The alpha channel, if it exists, of the images is ignored in the
 compositing process. Instead, the image is treated as if it has a
 constant alpha of 1.0.

defs.name: PREMULTIPLIED
defs.docs:
The alpha channel, if it exists, of the images is respected in the
 compositing process. The non-alpha channels of the image are
 expected to already be multiplied by the alpha channel by the
 application.

defs.name: POSTMULTIPLIED
defs.docs:
The alpha channel, if it exists, of the images is respected in the
 compositing process. The non-alpha channels of the image are not
 expected to already be multiplied by the alpha channel by the
 application; instead, the compositor will multiply the non-alpha
 channels of the image by the alpha channel during compositing.

defs.name: INHERIT
defs.docs:
The way in which the presentation engine treats the alpha channel in
 the images is unknown to gfx-hal. Instead, the application is
 responsible for setting the composite alpha blending mode using
 native window system commands. If the application does not set the
 blending mode using native window system commands, then a
 platform-specific default will be used.

defs.name: PointList
defs.docs: Each vertex represents a single point.

defs.name: LineList
defs.docs:
Each pair of vertices represent a single line segment. For example, with `[a, b, c, d,
 e]`, `a` and `b` form a line, `c` and `d` form a line, and `e` is discarded.

defs.name: LineStrip
defs.docs:
Every two consecutive vertices represent a single line segment. Visually forms a "path" of
 lines, as they are all connected. For example, with `[a, b, c]`, `a` and `b` form a line
 line, and `b` and `c` form a line.

defs.name: TriangleList
defs.docs:
Each triplet of vertices represent a single triangle. For example, with `[a, b, c, d, e]`,
 `a`, `b`, and `c` form a triangle, `d` and `e` are discarded.

defs.name: TriangleStrip
defs.docs:
Every three consecutive vertices represent a single triangle. For example, with `[a, b, c,
 d]`, `a`, `b`, and `c` form a triangle, and `b`, `c`, and `d` form a triangle.

defs.name: LineListAdjacency
defs.docs:
Each quadtruplet of vertices represent a single line segment with adjacency information.
 For example, with `[a, b, c, d]`, `b` and `c` form a line, and `a` and `d` are the adjacent
 vertices.

defs.name: LineStripAdjacency
defs.docs:
Every four consecutive vertices represent a single line segment with adjacency information.
 For example, with `[a, b, c, d, e]`, `[a, b, c, d]` form a line segment with adjacency, and
 `[b, c, d, e]` form a line segment with adjacency.

defs.name: TriangleListAdjacency
defs.docs:
Each sextuplet of vertices represent a single triangle with adjacency information. For
 example, with `[a, b, c, d, e, f]`, `a`, `c`, and `e` form a triangle, and `b`, `d`, and
 `f` are the adjacent vertices, where `b` is adjacent to the edge formed by `a` and `c`, `d`
 is adjacent to the edge `c` and `e`, and `f` is adjacent to the edge `e` and `a`.

defs.name: TriangleStripAdjacency
defs.docs:
Every even-numbered vertex (every other starting from the first) represents an additional
 vertex for the triangle strip, while odd-numbered vertices (every other starting from the
 second) represent adjacent vertices. For example, with `[a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h]`, `[a, c,
 e, g]` form a triangle strip, and `[b, d, f, h]` are the adjacent vertices, where `b`, `d`,
 and `f` are adjacent to the first triangle in the strip, and `d`, `f`, and `h` are adjacent
 to the second.

defs.name: PatchList
defs.docs:
Patch list,
 used with shaders capable of producing primitives on their own (tessellation)
